title: Verify: Standings should be separated by tabs
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
AND the user did not set any favorite teams
custom_steps: When the user taps the standings button
custom_expected:
Then the user is brought to the standings page where they see two or three tabs depending on the mode the app is in.
And if the app is in Triple-A mode they should see two tabs
OR if the app is in Double-A mode they should see three tabs
OR if the app is in Class A Advanced mode they should see three tabs
OR if the app is in Class A mode they should see two tabs
OR if the app is in Class A Short Season mode they should see two tabs
OR if the app is in Class Rookie mode they should see two tabs

title: Verify: Should be able to toggle back and forth between leagues without issue
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the app is in either Triple-A or Double-A mode
And the user is in the Standings section
custom_steps: When the tabs for the different leagues within each class are tapped
custom_expected:
Then the respective views should open
And the app should not crash

title: Verify: Ensure loading spinner appears while standings pages are loading
custom_preconds: Given the app has been installed
custom_steps: When the user taps the standings button or taps one of the tabs at the top of the standings window
custom_expected: Then the loading spinner will appear while the pages are being loaded

title: Verify: Standings page updates after being backgrounded
custom_preconds: Given the user is using a multi-tasking iOS device
custom_steps:
When the user opens the app
And goes to the standings page
And background the app
And open the app back up
custom_expected: Then the Standings pages will update instantly

title: Verify: When app is in Triple-A mode, correct standings tabs appear
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the app is in Triple-A mode
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to the More section
And the user taps the Standings cell
custom_expected:
Then the user should be taken to the Standings section
And the user should see tabs for: 'International', 'Pacific Coast' leagues.

title: Verify: When app is in Double-A mode, correct standings tabs appear
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the app is in Double-A mode
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to the More section
And the user taps the Standings cell
custom_expected:
Then the user should be taken to the Standings section
And the user should see tabs for: 'Eastern', 'Southern', 'Texas' leagues.

title: Verify: When app is in Class A Full Season mode, correct standings tab appears
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
AND the user has not added any favorite teams
And the app is in Class A Full Season mode
custom_steps: When the user taps on the Standings button on bottom navbar
custom_expected:
Then the user should be taken to the Standings section
And the user should see tabs for Midwest and South Atlantic
AND the user should see 1st Half and 2nd Half standings for both

title: Text should be clear and legible with proper headings and layout
custom_steps:
When the user taps the Standings button
And the "International" league tab is selected
custom_expected: Then the user can see the standings text with proper headings and layout

title: Intenational League standings should represent the correct teams
custom_steps:
When the user taps the Standings button
And the "International" league tab is selected
custom_expected: Then the user should see the correct teams in the International league. (See link)  http://web.minorleaguebaseball.com/milb/stats/stats.jsp?t=l_sta&lid=117&sid=milb

title: Correct information should be shown in standings
custom_steps:
When the user taps the Standings button
And the "International" tab is selected
custom_expected: Then the standings page should appear and the statistics shown should be: W, L, PCT, GB, L10, STRK, for each team

title: Teams are broken up by division: North, South, West
custom_steps:
When the user taps the Standings button
And the "International" tab is selected
custom_expected: Then the Standings page will be shown and the standings should be broken into North, South and West divisions

title: Each division will have a division winner - should be notated properly according to key
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
Given a team has clinched a division
custom_steps:
When the user taps the standings button
And the "International" tab is selected
custom_expected: Then the division winner[s] will be designated with symbol that is notated in the key at the bottom of the standings page

title: There will be one 'wild card' winner team - should be notated properly according to key
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
Given a team has clinched a wild card spot
custom_steps:
When the user taps the standings button
And the "International" tab is selected
custom_expected: Then the wild card winner will be designated with symbol that is notated in the key at the bottom of the standings page

title: Division winners (3) and wild card winner (1) will be competing playoff teams

custom_steps:
When the user taps the Standings button

custom_expected: Then the standings page should appear and the statistics shown should be: W, L, PCT, GB, L10, STRK, for each team

title: Each division will have a division winner - should be notated properly according to key

Given a team has clinched a division
custom_steps:
When the user taps the standings button
And the "Pacific Coast" tab is selected
custom_expected: Then the division winner[s] will be designated with symbol that is notated in the key at the bottom of the standings page

title: Scenario: Half standings defaults to the in progress half
custom_preconds: Given the user is in the Double-A standings
custom_steps: When the user taps on the Southern tab
custom_expected: Then the half that is in progress will be displayed

title: Scenario: Both half standings are accessible
custom_preconds: Given the user is in Double-A-->Southern Standings
custom_steps: And the user taps on the half standings tab
custom_expected:
Then the standings will go to the half standings that the user has tapped on
AND the standings will be accurate and formatted correctly

title: Scenario: Half standings goes back to active half after backgrounding app
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in Double-A-->Southern Standings
AND the user has tapped on the non-active half standings
custom_steps:
WHEN the user backgrounds the app
AND the user brings back the app to the foreground
custom_expected: THEN the half standings should go back to the half that is currently in progress

title: Verify First half division winner is noted in standings
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in Double-A-->Southern Standings
AND the user is on the active 2nd Half standings
custom_steps: When the user taps on the 1st Half standings tab
custom_expected:
THEN the user should see an asterisk symbol on the 1st half division winner teams
AND the 2nd Half standing should show the asterisk for the same teams
